nodes.name: Set input data
nodes.notes: This allows different routes to input into our agent (e.g. the retry branch). In the AI Agent, we can use a relative $json reference for data, since it's always the same input schema going in.

nodes.name: Set schem for rerun
nodes.notes: This set node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## #1 Serve chat, get URL from user, pull new notion DB schema
Uses n8n Chat trigger. Notion node will fail if an invalid URL is used, or if n8n doesn't have access to it. Also attempts to strip non URL text input. Simplifies notion DB outputs for more efficient token usage in AI Agent.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
## #2 GenAI step
Takes 2 inputs: [original workflow template]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} and new Notion database details from #1

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
## #3 Does the new workflow look right?
Checks for previously identified cases (e.g. LLM outputs placeholder for certain values) then does general LLM check on whether it looks like valid n8n workflow JSON.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Add feedback prompt

assignments.name: feedbackPrompt
assignments.value:
=You attempted the below task and outputted incorrect JSON. Below is your incorrect attempt and original task prompt. Try again.

# Incorrect task prompt

nodes.notes: This set node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Check for WF JSON errors
nodes.notes: Placeholder jsonBody in tool - this means the 'Search notion database' tool got [object Object] as it's value (happening ~25% of the time)

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
## #4 Respond to Chat trigger
Each response to the chat trigger is one run. Data of the last node that runs in the workflow is sent to chat trigger, like `Return success to chat`

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Generate Workflow Agent

parameters.text:
=Your task is to output a modified version of a n8n workflow template so it works with the provided new notion database schema. 


# new notion database details
{{ $json.inputDatabase.toJsonString() }}

# n8n workflow template to use as reference
{{ $json.workflowTemplate.toJsonString() }}

JSON Output:
- Ensure valid JSON with properly quoted keys and values, no trailing commas, and correctly nested braces `{}` and brackets `[]`. If unable to format, return an error or a valid example.
- Output linebreaks so user can copy working JSON

options.prefix:
You are an n8n expert and understand n8n's workflow JSON Structure. You take n8n workflows and make changes to them based on the user request. 

Don't hallucinate. Only output n8n workflow json.

nodes.notes: This agent node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Anthropic Chat Model2
nodes.notes: This lmChatAnthropic node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: When chat message received

options.title: 🤖 Notion database assistant generator
options.subtitle: Generates an n8n workflow-based AI Agent that can query any arbitrary Notion database.

parameters.initialMessages:
Hi there, I can help you make an AI Agent assistant that can query a Notion database.

Generating the workflow may take a few minutes as I check whether it works and try again if I oopsie.

Enter a notion database URL and I'll output the workflow in JSON that you can paste in to the n8n canvas.

nodes.notes: This chatTrigger node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Valid n8n workflow JSON?

options.systemPromptTemplate:
You are an expert in n8n workflow automation tool. You know whether the json representation of an n8n workflow is valid. 

Please classify the text provided by the user into one of the following categories: {categories}, and use the provided formatting instructions below. Don't explain, and only output the json.

nodes.notes: This textClassifier node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note5

parameters.content:
## Watch a quick set up video 👇
[![Notion AI Assistant Generator]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Stickynote Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Stickynote Workflow. This workflow integrates 11 different services: textClassifier, stickyNote, code, agent, outputParserStructured. It contains 24 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 24
- **Node Types**: 11
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Notion**: notion
- **Return success to chat**: set
- **Auto-fixing Output Parser**: outputParserAutofixing
- **Anthropic Chat Model**: lmChatAnthropic
- **Set schema for eval**: set
- **Return error to chat**: set
- **Anthropic Chat Model1**: lmChatAnthropic
- **standardize schema**: set
- **Simplify properties object**: code
- ... and 14 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
